messages.message: These peaks will be subtracted from other samples

How this efficiency should be interpreted.
Far Field: Point sources, or sources small compared to distance to detector; will allow changing detection distance to scale for 1/r2.
Fixed Geometry: For when characterization data geometry and distance matches measurements, and you will want to calculate total activity of the source (e.x. Marinelli beaker).\n
Fixed per cm2: similar to total activity, but when calibration data and measurements are for surface contamination, with values given per square centimeter.
Fixed per m2: similar to total per cm2, but for per square meter.
Fixed per gram: similar to per cm2, but for per gram of source.

The attenuation by the air, between the source and detector will be accounted for, to allow distance scaling (using the efficiency function at different distances) more accurately.
This is a larger effect at lower energies, or larger calibration distances.
Name of the detector response function to save to InterSpecs internal database so you can use the response function later. Name must be a valid filename (e.g., no \, /, :, etc. characters).
Optional description of the DRF to help remind yourself of details when you use the DRF in the future.
Make default DRF for serial number '{1}'
Make it so when spectra from a detector with a matching serial number is loaded into InterSpec, this detector response function will automatically be loaded and used.
Make it so when spectra from this model detector is loaded into InterSpec, this detector response function will automatically be loaded and used.

Export a N42 file containing all spectra and peaks used to create this DRF. Source and shielding information is also usually stored into the file as well to, in principal, except for detector diameter and equation orders, provide all the input information used to create the DRF.
Exports the DRF into a CSV file that contains all of the information of the DRF. Especially useful for using with other tools.
Exports a 3x5 style card that has a brief summary of detector performance.
Intrinsic Efficiency Equation is not valid.
Error saving DetectorPeakResponse to data base: {1}
No assoc. nuclide, {1} keV, Peak {2} counts
Detector diameter is invalid - assuming 2.54 cm.
